item.title: Queen's letter of support left Pelicot 'overwhelmed'
item.content:encoded: The Queen's note said Gisèle Pelicot's courage had "created a powerful legacy that will change the narrative around shame, forever".

item.title: UK basks in sunshine ahead of snow and ice weather warnings
item.content:encoded: After days of cloud and rain, the weekend starts sunny and cold with further snow and ice warnings as Simon King expalains

item.title: Tucker's 94 keeps Ireland's World Cup hopes alive
item.content:encoded: Stand-in captain Lorcan Tucker hits an unbeaten 94 to lead Ireland to a 96-run win over Oman at the T20 World Cup.

item.title: Ros Atkins on... Mandelson and the vetting system
item.content:encoded: Revelations over Peter Mandelson’s links to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have raised questions about how he became ambassador. Our Analysis Editor Ros Atkins reports.

item.title: Rising vet costs leave charity with £400k bill
item.content:encoded: The group, based in Solihull and Wolverhampton, says its vet bills are costing them more.

item.title: Police activity under way near Nancy Guthrie's home
item.content:encoded: A search has been carried out in Tuscon, Arizona, close to where the 84-year-old was abducted from nearly two weeks ago.

item.title: Sister of April Jones 'still waiting to wake up from nightmare' of her murder
item.content:encoded: April's disappearance in 2012 sparked the biggest missing person search in UK police history.

item.title: England's brave new era runs up against Murrayfield ghosts
item.content:encoded: England come in with all the momentum. Scotland arrive chastened. But the recent history of Test rugby's oldest fixture will take some escaping.

item.title: Watch: 'I am a survivor' Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC Newsnight
item.content:encoded: Ms Pelicot reveals it is "inconceivable" that the man she shared her life with "could have committed these horrors".

item.title: Gisèle Pelicot tells BBC: I felt crushed by horror - but I don't feel anger
item.content:encoded: In an extensive interview with Newsnight, the woman at the heart of France's biggest rape trial speaks about betrayal, healing and choosing the right path.

item.title: The Papers: 'Palestine Action ban ruled unlawful' and 'Matt grabs Olympic gold'
item.content:encoded: A number of front pages carry a photo of skeleton racer Matt Weston, who took home Team GB's first 2026 Winter Olympics medal on Friday night.

item.title: Two Britons among three dead in French Alps avalanche
item.content:encoded: The Britons had been part of a group of five people accompanied by an instructor, skiing off-piste in Val d'Isère.

item.title: Andrew facing claim he shared Treasury document with banking contact
item.content:encoded: Reports suggest the former prince shared a Treasury document when he was serving as trade envoy.

item.title: Stroke survivors trial new at-home tech: 'It's given me my freedom back'
item.content:encoded: Participants in the NHS 'Triceps' trial wear a device in their ear which emits electrical pulses while they do rehab.

item.title: Is dining out dying out?
item.content:encoded: The restaurant industry says it is facing a double whammy - rising costs and customers with less money.

item.title: Is dining out dying out?

item.title: Trump says Iran regime change is 'best thing that could happen'
item.content:encoded: The US President's comment comes as a second aircraft carrier heads to the Middle East to pile pressure on Iran.

item.title: She didn't expect to fall in love on ChatGPT - and then have to say goodbye
item.content:encoded: Rae began speaking to Barry after a difficult divorce, but Barry lives on an old model of ChatGPT that's being shut down.

item.title: Time will heal Beckham family relationship, says Gordon Ramsay
item.content:encoded: The celebrity chef urged Brooklyn to remember "one day you're not going to have your Mum and Dad", in the wake of a fall out with parents Sir David and Lady Victoria Beckham.

item.title: He was once a teen 'superstar'. Why did James Van Der Beek need help to pay his medical bills?
item.content:encoded: A fundraiser was setup to help the actor's family after expensive cancer treatments devastated their finances.

item.title: Kenyans drop flowers for Valentine's bouquets of cash. Not everyone is impressed
item.content:encoded: Bouquets of cash have been blooming in popularity in Kenya but recent warnings may slow the trend.

item.title: 'It was silly from me' - 'brilliant' Delap recovers from error
item.content:encoded: Chelsea striker Liam Delap turns in "top" performance in the 4-0 win over Hull City with a hat-trick of assists after missing a sitter.

item.title: The two Chinese-American Olympians competing for rival superpowers
item.content:encoded: Eileen Guo and Alysa Liu have been thrust into a debate that goes far beyond sports.

item.title: Shaidorov wins gold as 'Quad God' Malinin crumbles
item.content:encoded: Ilia Malinin, the red-hot favourite for men's figure skating gold, suffers a nightmare on the ice.

item.title: Heathrow not crowded but people walk in 'wrong place', says boss
item.content:encoded: Chief executive Thomas Woldbye says Europeans and Brits keep "crashing into each other" because they walk on different sides.

item.title: 'Matt Weston, take a bow!' - Team GB win first medal at 2026 Games
item.content:encoded: Matt Weston wins the first medal for Team GB at the 2026 Winter Olympics, taking home the men's skeleton gold at Milan-Cortina.

item.content:encoded: A Super Bowl advert had sparked new scrutiny of the smart doorbell company's privacy practices.

item.title: How Matt Weston handled pressure to win gold and GB's first medal
item.content:encoded: Matt Weston cements his status as the best skeleton racer in the world, as he makes history in emphatic fashion in Cortina.

item.title: How Weston handled pressure to win Olympic gold and GB's first medal
item.content:encoded: Matt Weston cements his status as the best skeleton racer in the world, making history by winning Olympic gold in emphatic fashion in Cortina and securing Team GB’s first medal of the 2026 Winter Games.

item.title: Inflation eases in US as prices for used cars fall
item.content:encoded: Prices rose by 2.4% in the year to January, the latest official figures show, the slowest pace since May.

item.title: Head of Dubai-based ports giant quits after Epstein links revealed
item.content:encoded: Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem’s exit comes after files showed he appears to have exchanged hundreds of emails with Epstein.

item.title: Boxers, dancers and weightlifters - the war dead pictured on banned Ukrainian slider's helmet
item.content:encoded: Vladyslav Heraskevych's helmet depicts fellow athletes who have been killed since Russia's full-scale invasion of his country.

item.title: Salmon exports remain high but Scotch whisky falls
